page.title: 18FRAMPTON UNITED CHARITIES
page.content: This charity has 6 trustees and the vicar. Land is owned in Frampton and other parishes. Revenue from land and other investments is used to help residents in the village. Brownies, W.I., Playgroup and Evergreen Club have rent paid. W.I. members are allowed bursary money. The Scouts receive help. Older villagers have help with fuel bills and summer outings are arranged. Widows and their children are assisted if the need should arise. Students have a book grant. The Charity owns the Old School and playing field and provides the childrens recreational area. Rents are reviewed tri-annually. The Charities are controlled by the Charity Inspectors in Liverpool.
